photoqt -- A simple and attractive Image Viewer

Lukas Spies

2018-11-24

Version 1.7.1

PhotoQt - A simple and attractive Image Viewer

Table of Contents

  • Synopsis
  • Description
  • Options
  • Files
  • Author
  • Bugs
  • See also
  • Copyright

Synopsis

photoqt [options] [filename]

Description

PhotoQt is a fast and attractive image viewer developed for different platforms. The application uses different engines display, so it supports more than 80 types of image files. In addition, it allows a fast and intuitive performance and management of images, achieving to interact with the user through shortcuts totally customizable. Thumbnails, slide shows, information on the Image (meta-data) and other features make PhotoQt a powerful choice as the default program for image viewing of your system.

Options

Generic options:
-h, --help
Displays this help.
-v, --version
Displays version information.
Interaction with PhotoQt:
-o, --open
Make PhotoQt ask for a new File.
-s, --show
Shows PhotoQt (does nothing if already shown).
--hide
Hides PhotoQt to system tray (does nothing if already hidden).
-t, --toggle
Toggle PhotoQt - hides PhotoQt if visible, shows if hidden.
--thumbs, --no-thumbs
Enable/Disable thumbnails.
Start-up-only options:
--start-in-tray
Start PhotoQt hidden to the system tray.
--standalone
Create standalone PhotoQt, multiple instances but no remote interaction possible.
General Options:
--debug, --no-debug
Switch on/off debug messages.
--export[filename]
Export configuration to given filename.
--import[filename]
Import configuration from given filename.
Arguments:
[filename]
File to open with PhotoQt.

Files

The application create and use the follow configuration directories:
$HOME/.config/PhotoQt
Personal settings on Linux platforms. Use the GUI interface in 'Settings' to modify them.
%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\PhotoQt
Personal settings on Windows platforms. Use the GUI interface in 'Settings' to modify them.

Author

Lukas Spies, developer, <Lukas@PhotoQt.org>.
Web page project: <http://photoqt.org/>.

Bugs

Send a report of bugs in:
  • Email: <Lukas@PhotoQt.org>
  • Development page: <https://gitlab.com/luspi/photoqt/issues>

See also

For more information about the features of the application, visit the online manual:
<https://photoqt.org/man/>
